chapter.title: Annex - Inventory of Base Permissions
chapter.para: The following table gives the full inventory of the individual permissions required to access modules and lists, to select transactions from a list, to open the input screens and to execute the various actions available in .

These individual base permissions are available to create Roles (in the Role Maintenance Module), Roles being sets of these base permissions. Since banks are also responsible for role definition and preparation for their customers, the full inventory of permissions is given, for both bank middle-office and customer features.
Whenever an authorisation is required in , the corresponding base permission is checked. User interactions are categorised into different Types:

listitem.para: Menu access(M): when a specific permission is required to view the menu or submenu.
List access (L): when a specific permission is required to be presented a list (e.g. list of pending swaps).
Screen access (S): when a specific permission is required to access the form (e.g. Swap input form).
Action (A): for push buttons (e.g. Swap input form Save button).

section.title: Client-Side Permissions
section.para: This section shows the permissions that grant a client user access to the features of :

section.title: Home Page
section.para: The home page has the following links to the product modules:

entry.para: Trade Applications Modules available in the Customer Home Page
Total Return Swap (link available to this module)
Index CDS (link available to this module)
Credit Default Swap (link available to this module)
Equity Option (link available to this module)
Index Tranche CDS (link available to this module)
Cap Floor (link available to this module)
FX Options (link available to this module)
Forward Rate Agreement (link available to this module)
Equity Swap (link available to this module)
Listed Option (link available to this module)
Trade Message Center (link available to this module)
Business Requests (link available to the CRM module)
This link gives access to the module, on the client side. At least the 'view' permission is required.
All users are granted access to at least the Change Password feature.
Within the Help popup, the topics accessible depends on the user permissions.

section.title: Asset Trades Modules
section.para: The modules that handle asset trades all have the same set of functions, and therefore parallel sets of permissions. The permissions are shown in the second table below, the Permissions Table. The first two letters of a permission's name show the module, as shown in the first table below, the Module Codes Table. For example, for the Swap module, the xx-access permission is sw-access.

entry.para: Remark: xx_access is a prerequisite to reach the module.
Additional check based on the transaction amount
Open list of existing trades for amendment
